That isolation would be a principle of a Quaker reform seems appropriate, considering their silent style of worship—see the article “To Wait Together upon the Lord in Pure Silence” in Volume Issue 3 of The Appendix. Both silence and sound, however, have also historically been used as a form of torture – see the article “Controlling Sound: Musical Torture from the Shoah to Guantánamo” in Volume Issue 3 of The Appendix.
